marketNews.title: Gold Price in Futures Market Strengthens +0.03% to US$2,935.3 per Troy Ounce
marketNews.content: The price of gold in the futures market strengthened +0.03% to the level of US$2,935.3 per troy ounce on Tuesday (11/2), after briefly penetrating the level of US$2,968.5 per troy ounce and marking an intraday all-time high record. This increase continued the strengthening of gold prices by +1.62% on Monday (10/2) night. The rise in gold prices occurred following the announcement from US President Donald Trump, who imposed a 25% tariff on all steel and aluminum imports to the US effective March 12, 2025. Besides these two metals, Trump also stated he would announce retaliatory tariffs this week, with the amount to adjust for tariffs imposed by other countries. This decision threatens an escalation of the trade war and a resurgence of inflation.

marketNews.title: Speaker of the House of Representatives Asks Heads of Commissions in DPR to Postpone Budget Efficiency Discussion Meetings
marketNews.content: The Speaker of the House of Representatives (DPR) requested all heads of commissions in the DPR to postpone the discussion meetings regarding the budget efficiency of ministries/agencies due to budget reconstruction from the government, based on a letter signed by Deputy Speaker of the DPR, Sufmi Dasco Ahmad. The Chairman of Commission VII of the DPR, Saleh Partaonan Daulay, told Kompas that he had received the letter and his commission had postponed the meeting with the Ministry of Industry which was originally scheduled for Monday (10/2). Saleh was reluctant to speculate on the reason the government finally requested a postponement of the budget efficiency discussion meeting with ministries/agencies, and asked that this matter be directed to the government and the DPR leadership. Previously, President Prabowo Subianto in January 2025 issued a presidential instruction to cut the 2025 State Budget expenditure by up to IDR 306.7 trillion.

marketNews.title: Commodity Analysis Firm Kpler Records Vietnam's Thermal Coal Imports in 2024 Grew +31% YoY
marketNews.content: Commodity analysis firm, Kpler, noted that Vietnam's thermal coal imports during 2024 grew by +31% YoY to 44 million tons, making the country one of the main drivers of thermal coal import growth, while global import growth only reached +1% YoY in 2024. This surge in thermal coal imports was driven by electricity needs for the manufacturing sector in Vietnam, with Reuters reporting that coal-fired power plant (PLTU) capacity in the country will increase by +15% after projects currently under construction are completed. Global Energy Monitor noted that installed power capacity in Vietnam currently reaches about 70 GW, with PLTU contribution reaching about 39%. Going forward, there are approximately 11.6 GW of new power generation capacity under construction in Vietnam, with PLTU growing by about 4 GW.

marketNews.title: Vice Minister of SOEs Kartika Wirjoatmodjo States Government Plans to Increase New and Renewable Energy Share to 70% of Additional Power Capacity in RUPTL 2025-2034
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, stated on Tuesday (11/2) that the government plans to increase the share of new and renewable energy (EBT) to the 70% level out of the additional power capacity in the Electricity Supply Business Plan (RUPTL) for the 2025-2034 period. This plan will replace the RUPTL for the 2021-2030 period, which targeted a total new capacity of 40.6 GW with about 52% of it coming from EBT. The RUPTL for the 2025-2034 period targets an additional power capacity of 71 GW, so the 70% EBT mix target during this period will drive the EBT mix in the total national power capacity up from around 12% to about 35% by 2034, according to Kartika. Based on the RUPTL for the 2025-2034 period, the government plans to build solar power capacity of 17 GW, hydropower of 16 GW, geothermal power of 5 GW, gas power of 15 GW, and other sources such as wind and bioenergy. The RUPTL also still plans an additional 5 GW of coal-fired power capacity until 2034.

marketNews.title: Chairman of Asaki Projects 3 Million Houses Program Annually Could Increase Ceramic Industry Utilization by +10-15%
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramic Industry Association (Asaki), Edy Suyanto, stated on Monday (10/2) that the association projects the government's program to build 3 million houses per year could boost the ceramic production capacity utilization rate by around +10-15% because the project requires about 110-115 million square meters of ceramic tiles. Asaki noted that the utilization rate as of January 2025 reached 73%, up from the 2024 realization of 64%. In 2025, Asaki targets the utilization rate to reach the range of 80-85%.

marketNews.title: Pefindo Estimates Corporate Debt Issuance in 2025 Will Range from IDR 139.29-155.43 Trillion
marketNews.content: PT Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia (Pefindo) estimates corporate debt issuance in 2025 will range from 139.29-155.43 trillion rupiah, with a midpoint of 143.91 trillion rupiah. In January 2025 alone, Pefindo recorded corporate debt issuance reaching 8.6 trillion rupiah, an increase compared to 6 trillion rupiah in January 2024. Throughout 2024, Pefindo recorded that corporate debt issuance reached 149.7 trillion rupiah (+15.84% YoY).

marketNews.title: OJK Chairman Predicts Capital Market Fundraising to Reach IDR 220 Trillion in 2025
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Financial Services Authority (OJK) Board of Commissioners, Mahendra Siregar, stated on Tuesday (11/2) that the OJK targets fundraising in the capital market to reach 220 trillion rupiah in 2025 (vs. the 2024 target: 200 trillion rupiah), although he did not elaborate further. This target is lower than the fundraising in the Indonesian capital market during 2024 which reached 259.24 trillion rupiah. Mahendra said that OJK will continue to conduct periodic reviews of this target in line with the development of national economic growth.

marketNews.title: BPH Migas Plans to Limit Subsidized Diesel Fuel Purchase Volume
marketNews.content: Head of the Downstream Oil and Gas Regulatory Agency (BPH Migas), Erika Retnowati, stated on Monday (10/2) that the agency plans to issue new regulations regarding the maximum volume limit for the distribution of subsidized diesel fuel (BBM). This discourse is intended to ensure targeted distribution. Currently, existing regulations stipulate that the maximum daily purchase volume for subsidized diesel is 60 liters for four-wheeled vehicles, 80 liters for six-wheeled vehicles, and 200 liters for vehicles with more than six wheels. However, the BPH Migas and Gadjah Mada University study team found that the existing quota is still too large because it exceeds vehicle tank capacity, potentially leading to misuse.

marketNews.title: DPR and Directorate General of Taxes Agree to Use 2 Taxation Systems: Coretax and the Old System
marketNews.content: Chairman of Commission XI of the DPR RI, Mukhamad Misbakhun, stated on Monday (10/2) that the DPR and the Directorate General of Taxes of the Ministry of Finance have agreed to use 2 taxation systems, namely Coretax and the old taxation system. This agreement was reached to overcome various problems that often arise in the implementation of Coretax.

tickerNews.title: DEWA Announces Additional Debt Conversion through Private Placement of ~3.95 Billion New Shares at IDR 75 per Share
tickerNews.content: Darma Henwa ($DEWA) announced a plan for an additional private placement of approximately 3.95 billion new shares at a price of 75 rupiah per share to convert debt amounting to approximately 296.6 billion rupiah to PT Antareja Mahada Makmur. PT Antareja Mahada Makmur is a company in the leasing and finance lease sector, as well as a creditor for DEWA's trade payable position amounting to 296.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Antareja Mahada Makmur's ownership in DEWA will become 9.7% from previously none. This corporate action is part of the private placement plan recently announced by DEWA. Previously, DEWA also planned a private placement of approximately 14.9 billion new shares at a price of 75 rupiah per share to convert debt to PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara and PT Andhesti Tungkas Pratama. Cumulatively, the total of these three private placements amounts to approximately 18.8 billion new shares. DEWA will hold an EGMS on February 13, 2025, to seek shareholder approval for the execution of this corporate action. DEWA shares closed up +8.74% at the level of 112 rupiah per share today, Tuesday (11/2). Key Takeaway: We assess that this debt conversion potentially provides short-term negative sentiment for DEWA because the execution price is lower by -33% compared to the company's share price today, and there is potential for significant dilution for existing shareholders. Based on our calculations, the total three private placements will cause a dilution of existing shareholders' ownership by approximately ~46.3%, with the public ownership portion potentially dropping from 71% to 38.2% post-transaction. From a financial perspective, the debt conversion totaling approximately 1.4 trillion rupiah has the potential to reduce DEWA's Liability-to-Equity Ratio from 1.32x to 0.62x. Although we assess this debt conversion is not the most ideal way to strengthen DEWA's capital structure, this corporate action can have a long-term positive impact if new shareholders can provide added value to the company going forward. *This article was first released as Stockbit Commentary on Tuesday (11/2) morning.

tickerNews.title: ASII: Automobile Wholesales -9% YoY in January 2025, Outperforming Industry Average
tickerNews.content: $ASII: Astra International recorded automobile wholesale sales of 34,531 units in January 2025 (-9% YoY, -18% MoM), which was better than the industry realization (-11% YoY, -23% MoM). Consequently, ASII's market share rose to 55.8% in January 2025 (vs. January 2024: 54.5%, December 2024: 52.8%). ASII's automobile wholesales in January 2025 were primarily supported by Toyota+Lexus sales reaching 22,132 units (+4.8% YoY, -17.5% MoM), while Daihatsu sales weakened to 9,983 units (-31% YoY, -24% MoM).

tickerNews.title: SCMA: Controlling Shareholder EMTK Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: $SCMA: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi ($EMTK), purchased approximately 102.7 million SCMA shares at an average price of approximately 196.4 rupiah per share between February 5-10, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 20.2 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 62.07% to 62.21%.

tickerNews.title: RAJA: Shareholder PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra Increases Stake
tickerNews.content: $RAJA: Shareholder of Rukun Raharja, PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra, purchased approximately 35.7 million RAJA shares at an average price of 2,000 rupiah per share on January 30, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 71.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Sentosa Bersama Mitra's ownership in RAJA increased from 35.231% to 36.076%.

tickerNews.title: BBTN: Fourth Quarter 2024 Net Profit IDR 925 Billion, Full Year 2024 Net Profit IDR 3 Trillion (-14% YoY)
tickerNews.content: $BBTN: Bank Tabungan Negara recorded a net profit of 925 billion rupiah in 4Q24 (-22% YoY, +59% QoQ). This result caused the net profit for the full year 2024 to decrease to 3 trillion rupiah (-14% YoY), equivalent to 97% of the consensus estimate. Net Interest Income (NII) decreased to 2.8 trillion rupiah (-19% YoY, -1.9% QoQ) in 4Q24, causing NII for 2024 to drop to 11.7 trillion rupiah (-14% YoY). Furthermore, the Net Interest Margin (NIM) for 2024 decreased to the level of 2.9% (vs. 2023: 3.8%), marking the lowest level in at least the last 10 years. On the other hand, other operating expenses rose +12% YoY during 2024, while provision expenses decreased by -46% YoY. Loan growth during 2024 only reached +7.3% YoY (vs. 2023: +11.9% YoY), which was below management's guidance targeting a range of +10-11% YoY.

tickerNews.title: BREN: Star Energy Geothermal Completes Salak Binary Geothermal Power Plant, Increasing BREN's Total Capacity by 15.5 MW
tickerNews.content: $BREN: The President Director of Barito Renewables Energy, Hendra Tan, stated that his company, through Star Energy Geothermal, has completed the construction of the Salak Binary geothermal power plant (PLTP). The PLTP can generate 15.5 MW of electricity, bringing the total installed capacity of geothermal power plants owned by Star Energy Geothermal up to 901.5 MW.

tickerNews.title: SIDO: President Director David Hidayat Buys 3.65 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $SIDO: The President Director of Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul, David Hidayat, purchased 3.65 million SIDO shares at an average price of 562 rupiah per share between February 7-10, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 2.05 billion rupiah. After this transaction, David Hidayat's ownership in SIDO increased from 0.019% to 0.031%.

tickerNews.title: WINS: Wintermar Offshore Marine Plans to Add 2 New Heavy Load Barge Vessels in 1Q25
tickerNews.content: $WINS: Investor Relations for Wintermar Offshore Marine, Pek Swan Layanto, stated that the company will bring in 2 new heavy load barge vessels in 1Q25. WINS management is also considering adding more vessels corresponding to the growth in OSV demand in 2025, although Pek Swan did not specify the number of additional vessels the company is targeting. WINS has allocated a Capex of US$20 million in 2025 (vs. 2024 Capex allocation: US$35 million). Previously, Pek Swan said that WINS targeted fleet utilization to increase to 75% in 2025 from 68% in 2024, following several drilling projects in Indonesia that have not yet commenced, such as the Masela and Andaman blocks.

tickerNews.title: PYFA: Pyridam Farma Accelerates Commercial Development Outside Prescription Drug Portfolio by Focusing on Consumer Healthcare and Beauty in 2025
tickerNews.content: $PYFA: Chief Commercial Officer of Pyridam Farma, Antes Eko Prasetio, stated that the company plans to accelerate commercial development outside the prescription drug portfolio, focusing on promoting consumer healthcare and beauty products in 2025 through Pyfahealth and Pyfabeauty. This strategy is part of PYFA's medium and long-term plan to provide holistic health solutions and strengthen the company's competitiveness in an increasingly competitive industry. However, Antes did not specify the target contribution of these two segments to the company's performance going forward.
